text: so Paris the day after and looks pretty
normal people are walking around they're
in the cafes they're in their favorite
patisserie and yet this isn't normal
the flowers aren't normal and well the
discarded surgical gloves and the slight
pool of blood is just a grim
illustration of what's happened here the
building in the background is the music
venue in which 80 people were murdered
last night and all morning people have
just turned up here and stopped and
stared and thought about what happened
inside cities do survive these moments
we know that from New York from Mumbai
Madrid London aerobics and yet there's
something different in the air here this
morning in Paris and it's the fact that
while people say they don't want to fear
to be afraid they are afraid they were
afraid of the next attack and they're
afraid of what does this mean for their
multicultural City their multicultural
society
